title: Animate shiny and rmarkdown Content when it Comes into View
text: function aniview() doesn’t work directly htmlwidgets. solution put htmlwidget inside container animate . example animating box() shinydashboard order use plotly.
code: library(shiny) library(shinydashboard) library(plotly)  ui <- dashboardPage(   dashboardHeader(title = "Basic dashboard"),   dashboardSidebar(),   dashboardBody(     use_aniview(), # use_aniview() should be inside the body element     fluidRow(       aniview(box(plotlyOutput("plotly")), animation = "slideInLeft"),     )   ) )  server <- function(input, output) {   output$plotly <- renderPlotly({     gg <- ggplot(mpg, aes(displ, hwy, colour = class)) +        geom_point()     ggplotly(gg)   }) }  shinyApp(ui, server)

title: Animate shiny and rmarkdown Content when it Comes into View
text: animate element R Markdown document, must first call use_aniview() inside R code chunk {r, echo = FALSE} code shown final document. can animate content R Markdown document using ::: markers rmarkdown package followed {.aniview data-av-animation="ANIMATE-CSS EFFECT"}. animate-css effects listed . example “slideInUp” effect. can learn CSS class markers Custom block chapter R Markdown Cookbook Yihui Xie.
code: ```{r, echo = FALSE} aniview::use_aniview() ``` ::: {.aniview data-av-animation="slideInUp"} This element will be animated. :::

title: Animate an element when it comes into view — aniview
code: if (interactive()) {  library(shiny)   shinyApp(    ui = fluidPage(      use_aniview(), # add use_aniview() in the UI      aniview(h1("Shiny with AniView"), animation = "fadeInUp"),      aniview(textOutput("text"), animation = "zoomIn")    ),   server <- function(input, output, session){     output$text <- renderText({ print("An animated text.") })   }  ) } #>  #> Listening on http://127.0.0.1:7558 #> [1] "An animated text."

title: Use AniView — use_aniview
text: animateThreshold integrer. +ve numbers delay animation sequence specified number pixels come view. -ve numbers trigger animation sequence prior element coming view. scrollPollInterval integrer. frequency user scrolling 'polled' .e. tested. milliseconds extension jQuery's -built 'scroll' event/handler. use_cdn boolean. TRUE use Content Delivery Network (CDN), true default, false use locally stored files.
